Author: @o0_VanYsH_0o
Comment: As someone who's played Mauga steady for the last Year, B-tier for this season is pretty solid. HOWEVER, he gets super hard if you don't have teammates peel for you, and he's not the one for Solo-que. He's really good though, and in the heat of the moment, I dare say fun. Learn your matchups against other tanks, and what you have to change to adjust your playstyle, and you can run Mauga against any team comp with success. However, if your supports are not on you, you will feel that instantly.

Author: @davidwaddell785
Comment: Sombra needs help, but it's unplayable.  As far as perks go, her CTRL ALT Escape and White Hat perks could use some love.  The critical health requirement could be removed from the escape perk and it still wouldn't be amazing, and the 4s cool down on white hat is a joke.  100 heals every 5 seconds is really low heals per second, less than half of a support, and can get interrupted by getting hit.  Lowering the cool down to 1.25 seconds, or less, is what would put Sombra in the same category as a support, so I don't think a 2 second hack cool down on heal would be too much to ask.

Author: @Thispersonisreal
Comment:
junkrat perks are the definition of "good idea, bad execution", the only good perk of his is tire one, but all the others just suffer from not being thought out much

frag launcher perk (the faster proj. speed) messes with your aim, junkrat aim is built on muscle memory of knowing how precisely your bombs travel, and while if it would be cool to have it early to get accustomed to increased speed, this is a major perk, 70% of the match you dont have it, you only got to use it for remaining 30%, it would benefit from splitting faster nades from dafault speed with a short wind-up similar to orisa spear perk

mine perk suffers not because of itself, but by everyone else, every single character has a way to destroy, evade or survive the mine, causing this perk to be niche, its kind of an unredeemable perk and needs to be replaced with sth new

trap perk is like - why? why would you ever chose throwing trap further over direct upgrade to your ult that before s15 sucked so much ass?

Author: @JAFARS0N
Comment:
What makes Paladins and Team Fortress 2 special? - PROGRESSION! (I know paladins is dead, but still)
Progression means that you can level up characters, collect stuff, change their abilities (loadouts in TF2) and completely redesign your favorite characters as you prefer and suits you.
These perks you've added during match is just 2%...
All you had to do was to add these perks / talents in the MAIN MENU! One big MAIN talent trees that will require account level.
Also separately add abilities - Active / Passive FOR EVERY SINGLE HERO! and also add progression to them - levels 10 max, on max level you will unlock every ability to choose from.
Season pass also in other games costs around 5 to 10$ - in OW2 - 20000000$ which is Bullshit! Make it affordable for everyone, if I have enough money, doesn't mean that I have to feed greedy devs. (before someone starts joking how broke I am)
Make CO-OP missions FREE for everyone! - MAKE MONEY ONLY WITH COSMETICS FFS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

And for god sake, remove 2 from title. Rename to Overwatch again.

These changes will make this game TOP tier, not just better than other hero shooters - overall TOP game of all time! AGAIN! - Even better

Author: @mogar5666
Comment:
Ive been a fan of OW since release. It was my go-to game, nothing felt as rewarding or hit the dopamine like OW1. I was also an early tester of OW2. I wasnt as frustrated at spending 15 CAD on a BP until they took out a large chunk of skins and got lazy with mythics. Theres no real customization anymore. It's just 'add on a piece or two' like shoulder plates for level 2, and at lvl 4 make it glow. The only thing that varies with skins is the handful of colours.

They showed they cared more about money than quality. Even these perks are recycled, probably "ready to go" (obviously not in a literal sense) and I just cant shake off how OW felt more like it only cared to take money from the top 1% of people who will spend all their money on the game's skins for the same 3 characters rather than throw a bone to give love to any other aspect of the game.

Venture didnt even have a legendary at release, and it seemed like that was the route they were going forward with every hero after.

Marvel rivals is a lot more friendly when it comes to monetization than OW. I could buy a great skin just by playing! Not to mention it felt REWARDING to play because they had missions that werent just 'play x amount of games. If you win, you gotta play the game a little less'

Author: @tuinhoofd1923
Comment:
I might like it as a separate game mode, I'm sad it's instead now the default, that's very personal preference though and I'm glad to see a lot of people are liking it.

I don't like the increased randomness and unpredicability, but mostly, I just don't like timed mechanics like this, for some reason I've always felt stressed out by time sensitive mechanics, be it timers, or things like sojourns mechanic that powers down if you're not shooting, hell even temporary buffs like the Witcher 3 shrines.

Things like that just make me stressed, and feel a ton of pressure, like I've got to make the most of it, it, be at my best. I know that's not true, but I can't shake the feeling, and it's turned overwatch 2 from my comfort game into something that feels like it's just not for me anymore.

I'm happy to see the Dev's try something new, I'm happy to see a lot of people feel like this has reignited their interest in overwatch, for me though I just feel like I lost my comfort game

Comment:
wow ok, this changed my view on the State of OW2. I stopped playing after they chose to scam their players with promise of PvE content on OW2 and then proceeded to scrap that and change OW to a 5v5 ( really messed up the core gameplay imo, since characters were designed to be play in a 6v6 format from the beginning). Not to mention, Papa Jeff left Overwatch as well, which was the final nail in the coffin for me. So i haven't played( other than custom games) since OW ended. it was really disappointing what they did to this IP. I was so excited to see the world develop and built; i found the characters to be quite interesting, so much so i had pre-ordered Overwatch when it was first launched. Then OW2 happened üòûüòû

Seeing this tho, which i'm glad i did,  makes me optimistic about at least the PvP of the game since it has one of my favorite character/hero to play in games: Widowmaker. i'd hop in time to time just to play widow HS lobbies but if what he's saying in this video is accurate, then i'll have to give the core game a try again. I'm still not spending a dime on it tho.

Author: @drakath5727
Comment: 9:45 Being someone who played through the entirety of 6v6's dead seasons I absolutely think the game flows better for every role if that 2nd tank exists. The difference is night and day to me - extra mitigation served to balance the supports' broken AoE utility by making it so it had to be timed right to when both tanks' guards were down, and the off tank being able to peel for supports and backline dps took off a bunch of the pressure for them when it came to facing down dive. Hell, a lot of the supports who enjoy being a powerhouse protector in 5v5 can then just make the jump to off tank in 6v6 since its effectively the same playstyle, which means that the roles' queue times will balance out much better.

Author: @eltoons
Comment: I feel like the overwhelming hate and slander around Overwatch is going too far. After literally getting to try the original 6v6 patch of Overwatch, the game has come a long way. As much as I love Overwatch 1, that dev team really wasn't good at balancing, especially compared to the Overwatch 2 team. They've had some misses, but at least they keep reassuring the community that their game is important and that they will work towards creating an experience that satisfies people. The player numbers don‚Äôt lie. I'm impressed that Overwatch isn‚Äôt like Apex right now, which is super dead. I feel like after the Marvel Rivals hype dies down, people will understand and maybe give more appreciation towards the balance in Overwatch 2. I guess I'm just optimistic, but after all the constant low-hanging fruit bashing on Overwatch, it‚Äôs refreshing to remember that it‚Äôs not all bad.

Author: @sd-king2916
Comment:
The genji perks have got to be the most frustrating thing I've ever read. Nothing about them is helpful. 

*swift strike deals 25 additional damage (passively healed by supports that arnt aware of the 25 dmg) and ONLY IF YOU USE IT SHORTLY AFTER GETTING AN ELIMINATION?!
Like wtf is this supposed to help genji do? It only happens after you successfully get the kill, which is the hard part. 

Double jump reset I guess helps you dodge sleep dart. But hit scans don't care about it. 

All this passive health gain stuff is the only viable option. But it doesn't change anything about his game play. Like If your genji and you execute well, you normally don't even take critical dmg. So self healing hardly aplys to genji, this should go on some other character.

Author: @popculture-videogames
Comment:
Alors, d√©√ßu par la dur√©e et le contenu de cette bande-annonce, m√™me si c'est g√©n√©ralement normal d'avoir une vid√©o de 2 minutes max pour la bande-annonce d'un nouveau h√©ros, j'attends toujours une vrai vid√©o "animated short" par h√©ros dans le genre de celle de Kiriko qui nous pr√©sente son contexte, sa vie, ses capacit√©s jusqu'√† son ult avec des moments absolument √©piques et beaucoup d'√©motions. 

Par contre : 

- Les fran√ßais ici qui parlent de lore en utilisant les traductions pourries pour les noms des h√©ros (Chacal ou Ange √ßa n'existe juste pas dans le lore d'Overwatch)
- Les fran√ßais ici qui se moquent du nom du h√©ros alors que le titre VO de la vid√©o va parfaitement avec le nom du h√©ros et que, bah r√©f√©rence au danger bact√©riologue bio hazard en fait...
- Les fran√ßais ici qui se moquent du manque de charisme du nouveau h√©ros alors que les VF sont juste nazes depuis toujours niveau doublage et traduction et pire depuis quelques ann√©es
- Les fran√ßais ici qui se moquent des dialogues alors que, bah les traductions sont effectivement bien pourries
- S√©rieusement, au-del√† de la remise en question, faudrait vraiment vous mettre √† l'anglais en 2024, on a des cours depuis le primaire et depuis les ann√©es 90 hein

Perso je suis tomb√© sur cette version fran√ßaise par hasard dans mes notifications sur les toilettes, et bien j'ai imm√©diatement regard√© la vraie vid√©o (en VO donc) sur le PC juste apr√®s. Pas moins d√©√ßu du contenu mais au moins la vid√©o est de qualit√© contrairement √† cette version compl√©tement plomb√©e par la VF et la traduction, comme d'habitude.

Des s√©ries Overwatch et Warcraft dans le genre de Arcane seraient juste incroyables. J'en r√™ve.

Author: @ExperimentalJr
Comment:
We all know why Kiriko, Juno and Dva get so many skins each season. Blizz knows exactly who will buy those skins and know that they are the ones that are most assiduous, just look at what those three have in common and you will find out, if you haven't already. I can even put Mercy and Widow in here even tho they aren't exactly made for the same "demographic", they have certain aspects in their character and design that falls into the same demographics as Juno, Kiri and Dva.

They know people who likes Hog/Ram/Venture/Sigma/Soujourn/Winston etc won't get as much skins as the others because characters that look and/or sound like grumpy adults or aren't barely reaching their adulthodd (in terms of looks and voices) won't sell as much as the ones that, even if not intentional (which I strongly doubt) were made with a very specific demographic in mind, and unfortunately, it won't chage since these are OW2 bread makers in terms of cosmetics.

Author: @zakthanos6231
Comment:
I loved the original Overwatch in my teens and waited years for the release. There was so much hope and passion. Hearing the interviews from the employees, the dreams of every single person on that team were poured into this IP. When Blizzard scrapped Overwatch 2, they scrapped the project many people had been preparing for their entire lives. Overwatch may have been a marketable PvP model, but Overwatch 2 was going to be the story of hope and making a difference these people had been dying to tell.

The current state of the world may feel like one big bad decision, but the small choices like these are what led us to where we are today. Choosing money over a dream.

Author: @Eternity-o1x
Comment:
Theres 2 problems with Tank, coming from a ling time tank main

1. You are almost completely at the mercy of your teammates. If they dont push the objective or defend it, you lose, if they dont stay together then theres also a good chance you lose and if the supports either dont heal you or only heal you then you lose

2. You are also at the mercy of metas, often Tank metas force both tanks to play the same tank, one goes Mauga, the other has to mauga, one goes Zarya, that happens because its easy to make them more powerful than their actual counters, which is stupid af on Blizzards part, thats when it literally just becomes a battle of attrition each fight

Author: @ilmw3980
Comment: The problem with tanks is they need to be strong enough (in 5v5) cause you are the only one in ur "job" (2 supps, 2 dps) and they need to be strong so people would play it (to compensate a lot of stress etc). BUT cause tank heroes are really strong on paper (some tanks can 1v3 depends on player ofc) they need to be countered by the enemys team. And this leads us to even more suffering as a tank player cause you play basically the strongest heroes in terms of pure stats and EVERYONE wants you to not play the game (CC, mei, reaper, orbs, nade and even enemy tanks like mauga) and thats not fun xd. And if your team doesnt play for counter their countres (like long range into reaper mei, kiriko for nade etc) you will suffer or play mauga\orisa to at least counter their tank. But its really fun and enjoyable to 1v5 as Queen with her super strong ult or bait and dodge sleep before killing enemy backline as winton

Author: @Nekroido
Comment:
Pro-tip on getting the chat logs: request the dump of your personal data through support ticket. You'll receive a giant HTML file with logs of transactions, acquisitions, and your own chat messages in all played Blizzard games.

And also, I'm yet to see a player writing the n-word (some see my name and decide to be racist and dyslexic) without consequences. Sometimes justice is swift, sometimes it takes about a week. Although I'm in EU region, so maybe it's a little different. But overall I feel your frustration, and it is warranted. Customer support and chat moderation are the easiest system to automate with natural language precessing since a lot of tasks are simple and repetitive. And the majority of issues mentioned have been around for at least a decade (remember TreeBoyDave?), so I would definitely blame non transparent ToS interpretation and default unfriendly treatment of customers by Blizz support staff.

Author: @GrayStoneTwo
Comment: Instead of playing the game this is me screaming at the void of collective automated responses and punishments. Help me understand (do not send me a link for Terms of Use or Code of Conduct). At this point (30 day suspension) is the player not supposed to/allowed to interact with anyone playing the game. My account has held high endorsement level and been playing since 2016 without issue until 2024/25, yet "You were reported multiple times" is enough to silence/suspend play. Since OW2's release account penalty IS more easily being handed out with bad judgement (automated legal precedent attached to vague terms and community interpretation; a capitalist's asinine approach catering to the engagement of players for profit). I should not be afraid to communicate  in fear of account ban because of misinterpretation of vague conduct. I'm tired of having to play a multiplayer team based game in complete silence, as if I'm suppose to be a bot without the ability to influence team play regardless of game mode (cosmetic focused ping system is a band-aid in a fast paced shooter). Every player using in-game communication channels inherit the risk of being silenced/suspended/banned due to an abused report system lacking context. I want to interact, I want to engage, but the conditions of 'unique reports' over X games have the power to penalized innocence. Players have the ability to mute/block/avoid at their discretion yet many are falsely being penalized due to not communicating or playing under the umbrella of what Microsoft and those who report find acceptable.

Author: @yousukeatagi8073
Comment:
This is kind of a separate topic but got my account wrongfully suspended for abusive chat and I decided for the first time to buy an account (completely fresh, no qp games nothing, basically just paying $5 for a burner number) to play while I wait for the suspension to lift. I change the e-mail and password right away as you are supposed to and I was perma'd before I even got to play. Game was never even launched, probably just got flagged for the sudden changes to the account details (e-mail said gameplay violation LMAO). So I said fuck it what's another $5 so I bought another and just didn't change the account information to see if it would be ok. I get to actually play for a couple of days and literally as I am finishing my comp placements (predicted to place at my main rank, not smurfing) I get perma'd again for "gameplay violation". 

Tbh this whole vendetta they have against alt accounts would actually be reasonable if they didn't just go around suspending and banning people for illegitimate reasons (yes I flame people yes i curse big fucking whoop). And then flag your device or ip for actually wanting to keep playing their game. To me it really has to be one or the other. If you're gonna put it between ChatGPT and God to decide who gets banned and who doesn't, let people have alt accounts. If you have a real human being (not JH) behind the desk actually doing their job and reviewing the validity of reports before handing out permas, then cool ban their alts too that's fair. Also stop treating mass reports from stacks as multiple reports. It's ridiculous.

 It sucks bc I truly do love overwatch as a game and simply spiting blizzard as a company isn't really enough reason for me to quit forever.

Author: @LuckyNobody1
Comment:
So us Doom mains have been asking for a parry feature to the block for a while and in a sense we got it but in such a weird way. 

It does prevent most CC but it also takes 20 less damage to get full charge (which is OP and due to normal block needing 100 damage at -20% damage reduction whereas power matrix just needs the 80 dmg) and you take no damage for that first second too (also OP) so it can be really strong against some comps. 

But Doom's most unfair counter still counters him... 

They could have gave doom 0.75 second of Orisa fortify, I think that would have worked a little better.

Author: @glassmonkeyface8609
Comment:
If you're wondering if you should come back because you gave up on the game being trash... don't bother.  They haven't actually fixed anything.  The matchmaking is STILL complete trash, still creates nothing but stomp games, and every game has at least one but usually a few obvious high level players on a smurf account to ruin matches for average players. Laughably they claimed in their stupid developer video to have worked on mAtChMaKInG, and as usual it's clearly a lie.  They just DON'T CARE.
The lootboxes will never give you anything new that's currently out, and all you get is sprays and souvenirs all the time.  The battlepass still sucks, and the store is still overpriced, except a couple bundles of really old skins they made now that they don't care about.  
Nothing has changed, they're just gaslighting and lying, like they always do.  They are just desperately trying to get players back from Rivals, which you can actually have fair games in and have fun.  I wish Overwatch 1 was still here.  And I wish these devs were gone.

Author: @Dyspeon
Comment: I downloaded Overwatch again for the first time in a couple years. Looking around through everything in Season 15, messing with the new abilities, it was a cool and nostalgic experience. But you guys will never be more than what you've done. I sat in the shop, staring at the $40 battle pass package, contemplating whether I'd get back into the game. That is a decision that I wouldn't even have hesitated on back in 2022. But you guys lost my trust, and that is something you simply cannot buy back with shiny new features that were promised years ago. I hope you guys wear your 22% rating on Steam like a badge of honor, because you will never be more than your mistakes after what you've done to your consumers. Actual joke of a company, but good attempt I guess.
